titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Music is revolution [sound recording] : from the John & Leni Sinclair Library / [produced and edited by Cary Loren].

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Music is revolution [sound recording] : from the John & Leni Sinclair Library / [produced and edited by Cary Loren].

odd.head: Publication, Distribution, Etc.
odd.p: Oak Park, MI : Book Beat Gallery, [2000]

odd.head: Formatted Contents Note
odd.p: 1. Learning the language (WPP Central Committee meetings, c. Fall 1968, but probably later) / voices: Pun Plamondon, Gary Grimshaw (0:25) -- 2. How to set up a chapter / voices: Skip Taube, John Sinclair (1:31) -- 3. Music is a revolutionary force / voices: Jesse Crawford, Pun Plamondon, Bob Rudnick, John Sinclair, David Sinclair, Gary Grimshaw, Genie Plamondon (3:36) -- 4. Culture & politics / same voices (7:36) -- 5. The connecting link / same voices (1:28) -- 6. Black Panthers & White Panthers / same voices (2:55) -- 7. Tit for tat / same voices (0:30) -- 8. The poem for Warner Stringfellow / John Sinclair, UM-Dearborn, 1967? (6:24) -- 9. Living in the woods / Pun Plamondon, c. 1970 (3:34) -- 10. Youth International Party / Genie Plamondon in Stockholm, c. 1970 (0:42) -- 11. The Sun - alternative newspaper / WXYZ-TV news report, c. 1969 (1:44) -- 12. A lot of shit is going down / John & Leni Sinclair, in automobile, c. 1968 (1:23) -- 13. The music scene is happening / John Sinclair, telephone

odd.head: Formatted Contents Note
odd.p: interview with Russ Gibb on WKNR-FM, c. 1968 (1:51) -- 14. Report from the road / John Sinclair WABX c.1968 (0:33) --15. SRC at Silverbell Hideout Radio Spot, c. 1968 (0:39) -- 16. Grand funk / Dan Carlyle and Frank Bach on WABX, c. 1970 (2:06) -- 17. Yin & Yang / same as above WABX c.1970 (1:02) -- 18. Great Black music / Joseph Jarman and David Fenton, c. 1970 (5:04) -- 19. Bad vibrations / Youth & Drugs Seminar, Hill Auditorium / voice: unidentified (0:50) -- 20. Plans for the summer / Gary Grimshaw, David & Leni Sinclair, interview with Jesse Crawford on WKNR-FM, c. 1970 (5:37) -- 21. Weather report / Bernadine Dohrn, c. 1970 (4:10) -- 22. Letter in exile / Pun Plamondon & David Sinclair, c. 1970 (2:05) -- 23. Media phenomenon in Michigan / Rainbow People's Party Central Committee meeting, December 1971 / voices: John Sinclair, David Sinclair (1:23) -- 24. This just clears your head up (RPP Central Committee Meeting, December 7, 1971) / voices: Leni Sinclair, David Sinclair, Pun Plamondon, John

odd.head: Formatted Contents Note
odd.p: Sinclair, Genie Plamondon (1:26) -- 25. On the women's movement (RPP) / voices: David Sinclair, Anne Lavasseur, Genie Plamondon (1:21) -- 26. I wanna freakize 'em (RPP, Winter 1971) / voices: John Sinclair, Leni Sinclair (1:01) -- 27. Prison interview / Bobby Seale, c. 1970 (5:47) -- 28. Interview with The Up / voices: Frank Bach, Bob Rasmussen, Gary Rasmussen, interviewed by Anne Lavasseur for People's Communications Committee, Ann Arbor, c. 1970 (0:44) -- 29. Observing John / Peter Werbe on John Sinclair, c. 1969=70 (1:33) -- 30. Zenta philosophy / Jesse Crawford c.1969? (1:49)

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: "A 72 minute spoken word audio CD that tells the history of the radical politics of the late 1960s. The CD was compiled from original source material in the archives of the John and Leni Sinclair library at the Bently Historical Library in Ann Arbor Michigan ... The CD charts the turbulent mixture of culture and politics in the late 1060's in spoken history"--The Book Beat's Oneline Bookstore (http://www.thebookbeat.com)
